Full Stack Embedded Software Engineer at Misceo Grand Technology

San Jose, Remote · Full Time
Misceo empowers individuals in high stress careers with an adaptive healthcare platform that enables objective health management based on insightful clinical data.Read More

Misceo empowers individuals in high stress careers with an adaptive healthcare platform that enables objective health management based on insightful clinical data.

While other devices are based on monitoring just heart rate, step counts and calories burnt, Our product evaluates users cardiac performance based on full spectrum clinical body analysis and help him understand his physique and over all performance. It helps the trainer to understand the behavioral pattern of cardiac activity of player, learns player's cardiac conditioning and helps them to enhance their performance. This information could play a vital role to optimize the players performance as well as avoid injuries in field.

Applied
Apply to Misceo Grand Technology
Add a message to Misceo Grand Technology
Apply

Job Description

Responsibilities

SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES

Misceo Grand Technology is seeking applicants interested in building leading edge medical devices and systems. Company is working in the space of connected healthcare providing next generation monitoring technology.

KEY FUNCTIONS

• We are looking for a software engineer with a blended skillset: digital/analog hardware familiarity, firmware, code on Linux and other platforms, e.g., Android, cloud. Familiarity with UI/UX technologies and web technologies.
• We are always looking for quality minds. We value curiosity and the internal drive to learn.
• Familiarity with signal processing, and sensor fusion among other requirements .

Qualifications :

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
• Bachelor of Science or Master of Science in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics or related discipline.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
• Proficiency in the C language. Working knowledge with one or more of: Python, C++, JavaScript,Node.js, Java.
• Deep experience with the Linux platform as both user and developer: tools, application development workflow, system programming.
• Familiarity with laboratory tools such as oscilloscopes, power supplies and multimeters.
• Effective verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
• Understanding of real-time, embedded, low power systems.
• Working knowledge of typical hardware interfaces: I2C, SPI, GPIO, UART, etc.
• Working knowledge of communication protocols like : BLE, MQTT , WiFi
• Working knowledge of typical networking stack and architectural principles: Ethernet, TCP/IP suite, HTTP, web services, e.g., REST.
• General, background familiarity with web technologies: databases, SQL, front-end frameworks, e.g., Angular/React/Ember/Backbone/Bootstrap

Compensation
$85K–$100K
0.2%–0.5%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available
Applied
Apply Now
Add a message to Misceo Grand Technology
Apply

Santa Cruz, San Francisco Bay Area

What We're Building

We at Misceo Grand Technologies, building a connected healthcare solution to decentralized our healthcare infrastructure and coordinate patient care services between clinics at remote locations and hospitals. While hospitals struggling managing multiple patients and re-admissions, We provide continuous real-time cardiac monitoring and analysis for Hospital and clinics: in-patient monitoring and Ambulatory out-patient monitoring to optimize the way healthcare services are being delivered today. Our cloud based Misceo Unity Infrastructure can monitor all essential body vitals and activity of patient and help in Cardiac events prevention, diagnosis, post-operative care and on-going management of patients through non-invasive monitoring.

Our multi-sensor Platform has been recognized for providing best quality clinical data by various cardiologists across US and India including Scripps Research Institute, San Diego, CA and Evergreen Health Hospital, Kirkland, WA.

Hiring in San Jose, Remote OK
1-10 Employees
$775K Seed in 2013
Healthcare, Medical Devices, Sports, Athletes

items.title: JAVA FX Developer (f/m) - Remote possible at PROEMION (Fulda, Deutschland)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Cloud Services, Information Technology, Telematics
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Remote details

Technologies

javafxpostgresqljavaelasticsearchgithub

About PROEMION

Our Offer

  • Independent work in a performance-oriented and challenging atmosphere
  • Short lines of communication and flat hierarchies foster an open working environment
  • Modern premises right in the middle of Germany featuring lounge, kicker-table, pool table, team events, additional allowance for “Fitness Insel” and childcare, flextime and further amenities

About Proemion

Since 1987 PROEMION has delivered CAN devices and connectivity solutions for the most demanding industrial applications. The world’s most respected industrial equipment companies rely on Proemion, to design and build top-notch telematics solutions that enhance performance and safety. On the embedded side, we manufacture Telematics devices to collect and transmit CAN-based telemetry data. On the web services side, we use the latest Big Data technologies to process, analyze, and serve billions of data points through our APIs and web portal.

Ready for the challenge?

We look forward to your application via our career portal career.proemion.com or via e-mail (career@proemion.com)!

Let’s build something great together!

Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Billiard table
  • Mentoring programm
  • Modern development environment
  • Team events
  • Sport sponsoring
  • Flexible working times
  • Free soft drinks, fruit and cereals at our headquarter in Fulda
  • Home office option
  • Periodic face-to-face meetings with the team

items.title: Android and Web Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=16, other=5, dotnet=0, c=4, mobile=35, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=19, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=64, frontend=9}
items.content:
Android and Web Developer

Company: MAVN
Remote

Android and Web Engineer

MAVN is growing! This listing is for an Android/Web Technologies engineer.

MAVN provides high quality and affordable online ordering services for restaurants all over America. Our clients depend on our field devices and point-of-sale integrations to be as bulletproof as possible given that we deploy to actual physical restaurants.

We're sunsetting the embedded Linux device we use to print orders and notify restaurants in favor of an Android application. We have grand designs for what merchants will be able to use this new app for, but for now the big focus is in migrating from the embedded Linux machines to Android tablets. This area of responsibility could be yours!

In your first few quarters with MAVN, you'll take the code that powers our existing Android integration services, and adapt it for use as a standalone app. As other engineers on the team build out APIs to support our backoffice rewrite, you'll help design and implement APIs that the new Android app will consume as well.

MAVN is a Texas company with remote employees in far-flung parts of the United States. Work happens over git, email, and chat.

Organizational and technical responsibilities:
- leverage and rewrite existing Android code
- reimplement the core functionality of our embedded Linux devices on Android tablets
- support other core MAVN products
- support stability of your Android code in the field
- uptime and reliability for services that you write
- supporting our Customer Support staff

Technical qualifications:
- several years experience in a professional software development environment
- strong knowledge of the Android ecosystem and build toolchain
- strong Java abilities
- professional experience with user interface development in Android and the browser stack

Personality and interpersonal:
- comfortable working from home and collaborating asynchronously over chat
- receptive to code review feedback
- curious, self-starting, hard-working, detail-oriented
- know when you're stuck, can ask questions instead of spinning fruitlessly

The MAVN engineering team:
- opinionated and argumentative, but never dogmatic
- preference for strong type systems and data integrity
- values prudence and caution in the code we write and how we deploy it (we're responsible for other people's money and their tacos coming up on time)
- takes the time to build things well
- strong preference for simplicity and correctness
- 100% remote
- very few meetings or phone calls

The MAVN stack and roadmap:
- we're migrating our embedded Linux product to an Android application
- we're chipping a legacy Django monolith apart
- new APIs are completely decoupled from legacy Django machinery
- we run on a SQL data store
- we use AWS judiciously
- we write APIs largely with stored procedures
- we write services largely with Common Lisp
- we write frontend applications with React and Typescript

Career opportunities:
- build an app that merchants will rely on for a significant fraction of their revenue
- enable our support staff to be the superstars our clients need
- scale our database horizontally as we add ever-larger customers and serve ever more tacos
- work on Android and Web applications, delivering best-in-class user experiences for online ordering
- build APIs to support growth and integration with more partners
- invent and build new products for the restaurant industry

To apply: benv+jobs@mavn.is

items.title: Integrations and Backend Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=18, other=10, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=5, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=4, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=16, frontend=9}
items.content:
Integrations and Backend Engineer

Headquarters: Austin, TX
URL: https://mavn.is

Integrations and Backend Engineer

MAVN is growing! This listing is for an Integrations and Backend Services Engineer.

MAVN provides high quality and affordable online ordering services for restaurants all over America. Our clients depend on our field devices, backend services, and point-of-sale integrations for serious fractions of overall revenue. Customers using our product depend on it working all the time, every time, so that their tacos come up as close as possible to the promised time.

MAVN is building out more systems than ever to support our growing client list and the integrations their customers clamor for. The good ship MAVN needs a few additional hands in the engine room to work on our Postgres database, APIs, background services and new integrations with point-of-sale systems, loyalty companies, gift card companies, payment companies, and more! The number of orders we deliver to restaurants is growing at an awesome monthly rate, and we need folks who can help us scale this monster.

In your first few quarters with MAVN, you'll build a few integrations between our systems and third-party systems, in the process learning our data model, and loading our infrastructure, deploy, tooling, and software philosophy into your head. As we grow comfortable with each other's work, we may task you with carving parts of our legacy monolith into services, or shanghaied into the frontend rewrite. As you integrate as a full member of the team, you will help us set standards, design systems, think rigorously, and do the right thing for our clients, their customers, and the whole company.

We're big fans of RDBMSen, and leverage our database's type system wherever we can. We're pragmatic testers, with a custom DB-layer testing system that you'll probably get a kick out of.

Since we're growing quickly, you'll have a lot of autonomy in how you perform your work. Our short term roadmap is focused on launching a complete rewrite of the customer-facing software, but once the bulk of that is off of the Engineering team's plate, there will be a bunch of awesome new projects that we'll need your hands on.

MAVN is a Texas company with remote employees in far-flung parts of the United States. We collaborate over git, email, and chat.

Organizational and technical responsibilities:
- new systems development
- uptime of the systems that you build
- support core MAVN products
- maintenance and bug fixes against your and others' code
- support of customer-facing staff as appropriate

Technical qualifications:
- several years of experience with Linux
- experience working with common backend languages (Python, Java, Ruby)
- experience with Common Lisp or similar (nice-to-have)

Personality and interpersonal characteristics:
- comfortable working remotely, and collaborating asynchronously over chat
- receptive to code review feedback
- comfortable with the oncall lifestyle
- curious, self-starting, hard-working, detail-oriented
- know when you're stuck, can ask questions instead of spinning fruitlessly

The MAVN engineering team:
- opinionated and argumentative, but never dogmatic
- preference for strong type systems and data integrity
- values prudence and caution in the code we write and how we deploy it (we're responsible for other people's money and their tacos coming up on time)
- takes the time to build things well
- strong preference for simplicity and correctness
- 100% remote
- very few meetings or phone calls

The MAVN stack and roadmap:
- we're migrating our embedded Linux product to an Android application
- we're chipping a legacy Django monolith apart
- new APIs are completely decoupled from legacy Django machinery
- we run on a SQL data store
- we use AWS judiciously
- we write APIs largely with stored procedures
- we write services largely with Common Lisp
- we write frontend applications with React and Typescript

Career opportunities:
- build software merchants rely on for a significant fraction of their revenue
- scale our database horizontally as we add ever-larger customers and serve ever more tacos
- build out new services to grow our competetive advantage
- build APIs to support growth and integration with more partners
- invent and build new products for the restaurant industry
- tackle scaling challenges as we hit them

To apply: [email protected]

items.title: Airtame (https://airtame.com) | Copenhagen, Denmark | Full-time, Onsite/Remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=16, frontend=0}
items.content:
Airtame (https://airtame.com) | Copenhagen, Denmark | Full-time, Onsite/Remote

Airtame is a fast-growing startup. Our wireless streaming solution helps people work better. We are based in windy Copenhagen, but have an office in New York that takes care of our U.S. customers. We're currently hiring:

* Lead DevOps Engineer - Copenhagen, Denmark (https://airtame.com/jobs?gh_jid=4036513002)

* Head of Engineering - Copenhagen, Denmark (https://airtame.com/jobs?gh_jid=4031232002)

* Senior Embedded Linux Engineer - Copenhagen, Denmark or Europe (https://airtame.com/jobs?gh_jid=4010452002)

* Senior Digital Designer - Copenhagen, Denmark (https://airtame.com/jobs?gh_jid=4010466002)

* Web Developer - Copenhagen, Denmark (https://airtame.com/jobs?gh_jid=4017568002)

Our talented engineers are given significant ownership and responsibility over projects. We value rapid iteration, continuous integration and testing, and we are serious about producing high-quality, maintainable software. Frequent code reviews, linting, and pairing are all integral components of our engineering culture. We encourage experimenting with new technologies and constantly challenge ourselves to improve our code, processes, and systems.

Get to know about our Engineering team: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4jUqPWEvMlg

We sponsor work visas for non-EU applicants.

items.title: SENIOR FULL-STACK DEV WITH RUBY/PYTHON/REACT -- 100% REMOTE, FLEXIBLE HOURS
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=10, other=0, dotnet=0, c=21, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=14, bigdata-ml=4, ruby=10, apple=2, java=9, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=32, frontend=33}
items.content:
SENIOR FULL-STACK DEV WITH RUBY/PYTHON/REACT -- 100% REMOTE, FLEXIBLE HOURS

Company: Analytics Fire

Job Description


Analytics Fire builds custom software for the solar power industry. We’re looking for a senior full-stack developer with a willingness to acquire deep expertise around Ruby, Python, and React.js, in order to help us expand to support additional new high-tech sectors.

Analytics Fire is a small, distributed team working on a range of interesting projects. For example, last year we worked on a scalable IoT platform for utility grade solar power plants, a sales and design tool for residential solar, and a machine-learning powered autonomous cleaning robot. We’re looking for a fun, reliable, and highly collaborative, senior dev to join our team.

For reference, here is a list of technologies and tools we are currently actively using on a day-to-day basis:

  • Front-end: JavaScript / React / Angular

  • Back-end: Ruby / Python / Node.js

  • Embedded (IoT): C, Embedded Linux, MQTT

  • Embedded (robotics): C/C++, ROS

  • Modern software techniques: RESTful APIs, SOA, PaaS, etc

  • Agile collaboration and DevOps tools: Github, Trello, Slack, Chef, Ansible, Docker, Vagrant, etc

  • Occasionally we need to do a small amount of work around: SFDC, iOS, Android, ARKit

This is a remote position. We’re flexible about location and hours, so long as your working hours are in a very heavily US-overlapping time zone (eg: North America, Central America, South America, etc). We’re a really great match for a senior dev in a US-overlapping timezone who wants to work hard on interesting projects, while also having flexibility around time and geography.

Skills & Requirements


Ideally, you should have 5+ years commercial full stack development, ideally within a startup environment. You should be comfortable autonomously driving your own high quality / high velocity contributions using a range of technologies.

We work with a variety of technologies, but are currently specifically looking for someone that has or can obtain expert level skills around Python, Ruby, and React.js.

About Analytics Fire


Analytics Fire was founded by a couple of data-nerds -- one a PHd in machine learning and the other a former VP of Engineering for an analytics platform -- who both are also serial entrepreneurs backed by prominent angels and VCs including Y Combinator and 500 Startups.

“Our goal founding, Analytics Fire, was to create the engineering department that we always dreamed of working for. Our dream is to be able to spend our time working on interesting problems, while simultaneously having flexibility around time and geography and being part of a small, tightly-knit team of world-class engineers.”

join-us@analyticsfire.com

items.title: Senior Full-Stack Dev (Ruby/Python/React) - 100% Remote, Flexible Hours at Analytics Fire
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=8, other=0, dotnet=0, c=21, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=14, bigdata-ml=4, ruby=8, apple=2, java=9, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=32, frontend=25}
items.content:
About this job Job type: Full-time Experience level: Senior Role: Full Stack Developer Industry: Software Development / Engineering Company size: 11-50 people Company type: Private Technologies rubyreactjsjavascriptpythonruby-on-rails Job description

Analytics Fire builds custom software for the solar power industry. We’re looking for a senior full-stack developer with a willingness to acquire deep expertise around Ruby, Python, and React.js, in order to help us expand to support additional new high-tech sectors.

Analytics Fire is a small, distributed team working on a range of interesting projects. For example, last year we worked on a scalable IoT platform for utility grade solar power plants, a sales and design tool for residential solar, and a machine-learning powered autonomous cleaning robot. We’re looking for a fun, reliable, and highly collaborative, senior dev to join our team.

For reference, here is a list of technologies and tools we are currently actively using on a day-to-day basis:

  • Front-end: JavaScript / React / Angular
  • Back-end: Ruby / Python / Node.js
  • Embedded (IoT): C, Embedded Linux, MQTT
  • Embedded (robotics): C/C++, ROS
  • Modern software techniques: RESTful APIs, SOA, PaaS, etc
  • Agile collaboration and DevOps tools: Github, Trello, Slack, Chef, Ansible, Docker, Vagrant, etc
  • Occasionally we need to do a small amount of work around: SFDC, iOS, Android, ARKit

This is a remote position. We’re flexible about location and hours, so long as your working hours are in a very heavily US-overlapping time zone (eg: North America, Central America, South America, etc). We’re a really great match for a senior dev in a US-overlapping timezone who wants to work hard on interesting projects, while also having flexibility around time and geography.

Skills & Requirements

Ideally, you should have 5+ years commercial full stack development, ideally within a startup environment. You should be comfortable autonomously driving your own high quality / high velocity contributions using a range of technologies.

We work with a variety of technologies, but are currently specifically looking for someone that has or can obtain expert level skills around Python, Ruby, and React.js.

Apply now Ask a question About Analytics Fire

Analytics Fire was founded by a couple of data-nerds -- one a PHd in machine learning and the other a former VP of Engineering for an analytics platform -- who both are also serial entrepreneurs backed by prominent angels and VCs including Y Combinator and 500 Startups.

“Our goal founding, Analytics Fire, was to create the engineering department that we always dreamed of working for. Our dream is to be able to spend our time working on interesting problems, while simultaneously having flexibility around time and geography and being part of a small, tightly-knit team of world-class engineers.”

Benefits
  • Remote
  • Flexible Schedule

items.title: Senior Cybersecurity Engineer (RMF SCA-V, REMOTE)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Cybersecurity Engineer (RMF SCA-V, REMOTE) - Jobmote

Senior Cybersecurity Engineer (RMF SCA-V, REMOTE)

Netizen Corporation

Job Description

Under general direction, performs and leads support of Assess and Authorize (A&A) or other RMF and cybersecurity Compliance and Auditing processes and inspections for all enterprise systems and networks; ensures validity and accuracy review of all associated documentation. Leads and performs compliance reviews of computer security plans, performs risk assessments, and validates and performs security test evaluations and audits. Analyzes and defines security requirements for information protection for enterprise systems and networks. Assists in the development of security policies. Analyzes the sensitivity of information and performs vulnerability and risk assessments on the basis of defined sensitivity and information flow. Assess security risk, research and recommend countermeasures in accordance with Army and DoD requirements, conduct formal security engineering assessments and security assessments. Be an integral member of the team of cybersecurity validators to ensure that US Army systems are compliant with NIST Special Publication 800-53 rev4 cybersecurity controls. Professionally certified as Technical Level III as defined by DODI 8570 is a requirement.

Requirements:

  • Security+ CE and CISSP certification to qualify at DODI 8570 IAT III
  • Deep experience with eMASS, ACAS, and other tools
  • Technical background and certifications (e.g. CCNA, RHEL, etc.) preferred
  • Background in RMF Security Control Assessment (especially with the U.S. Army is preferred)
  • Knowledge of DIACAP to RMF transition process
  • ACTIVE TOP SECRET SECURITY CLEARANCE REQUIRED (U.S. CITIZENS ONLY)
  • Ability to travel up to 35% of the time but work remote the remainder
  • Live within 50 miles (commuting distance) of a military facility having SIPRNet access

Company DescriptionNetizen is an award-winning company that develops and leverages innovative solutions to enable a more secure and integrated cyberspace for clients in government and commercial markets. Every product and service we offer is backed by our renowned White Glove Service pledge that guarantees exceptional responsiveness and support for our clients.

We value every employee and, as such, provide unparalleled workplace flexibility (when available), a Veteran-friendly culture, competitive compensation, matching contribution retirement plan, numerous opportunities to learn new things with education reimbursement or free skills training, a team-oriented environment, a great benefits program including sponsored health, medical, life, disability, and dental insurance plus much more. We have high expectations for those who will join us in our mission, but we also provide ample perks as a reward for dedicated service such as ample paid time off.

Netizen Corporation is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation or any other protected status. Military veterans welcome.

items.title: Android Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=8, other=0, dotnet=0, c=2, mobile=18, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=16, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=16, frontend=0}
items.content:
Printt (Formerly called AIWIP) was founded 2014 in London; Our team of 10 have successfully grown from 50 to 500 printers.
We are the world’s only network of public printers; It allows anybody to print straight from their phone to one of our printers with zero configuration. In addition, It also enables students to print for free via advertising.
It’s a disruptive service that’s changing the printing industry — one that prints millions of pages every year.

About the Role

You would be helping to craft the next generation of our Android application for both mobile and embedded devices to help us grow to the next 5k printers.
You will join our small team of 4 engineers to help build the next iteration of our service. You will liase with our CTO and founding team to plan features and create a great expeirence for our users
You will be working with Java, RxJava, Retrofit, Butterknife, iBeacon and OkHTTP. We haven’t embraced Kotlin yet but we are keeping our eye on it.
If you are someone looking for the next step in their career? Then this could would be ideal for you

Essential

At least 3 years experience in Android development, from conceptualisation through to successful launch of an application in Google Play
* You have experience in using git and version control in combination with agile development.
* You are up to date with the latest features and developments for Android, including features in upcoming SDKs, resource optimisation techniques, device quirks and social network integration (e.g. Facebook)
* Ideally you should know about VPN Services and Bluetooth Beacons
* You have developed good personal time management and team working skills.
* You can describe complex issues to non-technical users and debugging problems.

Desirable

* Experience with Pusher, Stripe, Fabric and Facebook SDKs
* * Experience in deploying Android Apps to embedded devices (For example a Smart TVs or POS systems)
* Knowledge of RxJava
* Sense of humour and a love of hummus

Benefits:

* Pick your own holidays– it puts you in control of the amount of holiday you take, no waiting for it to accrue
* Flexible Working – Work from home when you want a pyjama day or you just need to catch up on things (It happens!)
* Small and Friendly Team – Relaxed atmosphere with opportunities for growth, learning new skills and hopefully teaching eachother.
* Choose your own laptop (Mac or PC)
* Free Beer on Tap
* Bring your pet to the office to enjoy the balcony with Tower Bridge Views

We are empathetic, so if you feel you meet some of these requirements then don’t hesitate to apply.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.title: Full Stack Salesforce Architect at Synaptic Advisory Partners (Annapolis, MD)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=1, go=3, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=1, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=4}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, SaaS
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

salesforceapexvisualforcejsonxml

Job description

What we are about

We <3 our team and our customers. We have passion and innovation embedded in our DNA, and we go out of our way to encourage our employees to share new ideas and feedback on a regular basis.  Our mission is to deliver solutions that help our clients better engage and interact with their customers, employees, patients, and constituents by providing solutions that make the right thing easy to do.

Synaptic AP is a leader in the development and deployment of cloud-based solutions.  In addition to our world-class Salesforce.com consulting practice, we have two flagship products - SynapseTM, a population health management solution serving over one million lives around the United States, and YourekaTM, the leading tool for forms, field assessments, and guided sales and service on the Salesforce platform.

We have

  • An amazing team focused on doing #Whateverittakes to help our clients and teammates be successful
  • A calling to innovate and improve every day
  • A competitive benefits and compensation package
  • Room for rapid growth and an emphasis on talent development
  • A fun, casual team environment with cool co-workers who will make you feel like you are an important part of our team, engage you in developing new solutions to challenging problems, and help you leverage your strengths to make all of us better!
  • A great benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401k, AD&D and Life Insurance coverage, STD coverage, PTO, sick leave, wellness initiatives, and more!

What you will do

You will be involved in all phases of the product development life cycle, working closely with our internal product team to assist with the design, development and launch of new products, features, enhancements and improvements. The Technical Architect will lead technical requirements sessions, making technology easily understandable for end users, act as a liaison between clients and Synaptic’s internal development team, and showcase the potential power and value of our products in a very customer-centric, supportive and comprehensive fashion.

Skills and experience you need to be successful

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
  • 3+ years working with Salesforce.com as an Architect
  • 3+ years working with VisualForce and Apex
  • Strong knowledge of software development lifecycles, systems engineering and business process re-engineering.
  • Experience with system integrations, preferably involving Salesforce.com
  • Experience with web services: JSON, XML
  • Experience with some or all of the following: a C-based language (preferably Java), SQL, HTML, CSS, Javascript (any popular framework)
  • Knowledge of data management, including data capture, warehousing, segmentation, mining, storing, cleaning and security
  • Certified Force.com Developer (DEV401) or Advanced Developer (DEV501)
  • Certified Sales Cloud or Service Cloud Consultant
  • Healthcare industry experience preferred
  • Project management experience preferred

Location

The Technical Architect position can be located Remote, or in our Annapolis, MD or Stuart, FL offices.

Synaptic Advisory Partners is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, who participates in E-Verify. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, gender, religion, age, disability, veteran’s status, or any other classification as required by applicable law.

Apply now
Ask a question

About Synaptic Advisory Partners

Synaptic AP specializes in the development and deployment of secure, cloud-based enterprise applications on the Salesforce.com platform for organizations worldwide. As a Salesforce implementation consulting partner, our custom solutions are built-to-scale to meet your unique business needs. Synaptic AP is looking for dynamic, independent, critical-thinkers who have a passion for making a difference, while building a career. 

Our company offers an entrepreneurial, casual, team atmosphere. Employees at Synaptic work hard but have a lot of fun. We offer competitive salaries, aggressive incentive programs, and rapid growth potential. Our team is looking for self-starting individuals who take pride in their work, excel in working collaboratively as part of a team, have a strong desire to learn new technologies and business practices, and have a consultative, customer service mindset.

Check out our current job openings at http://www.synapticap.com/careers/

Benefits

  • Medical
  • Dental
  • 401k
  • Vacation
  • gym expense
  • adventure fund
  • national park pass
  • casual dress

items.title: USB/SLEPOS Developer/ Kernel Engineer (Global) Flexible Location at SUSE (Nürnberg, Germany)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, OpenStack
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Private

Technologies

linuxcusblinux-kernelpython

Job description

(Global) Flexible Location

In this role, you will be responsible for enabling various Point of Service (POS) hardware to work flawlessly with SUSE Linux enterprise products. The Hardware Enablement Team is a group of a

dozen people in different locations with different areas of expertise, ranging from small peripherals to crucial systém components (graphics) to specific platforms (ARM, IBM POWER).

Key Responsibilities:

  • Development of new code and backporting to older releases.
  • Bug analysis and bugfixing.
  • Close collaboration with upstream communities.
  • Technical discussions with SUSE partners and other stakeholders.

Required Skills:

  • Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or comparable qualifications.
  • Excellent knowledge of the C programming language.
  • Open source community participation.
  • Experience with system-level programming.
  • Solid understanding of the USB protocol.
  • Self-reliance.

Recommended Skills:

  • Shell and/or Python programming.
  • Contributing to the Linux kernel.
  • Knowledge of the Linux USB driver stack.
  • Knowledge of Linux power management.

Work Location:

With the team being distributed, the engineer can work at any SUSE office (or home office) worldwide, although Europe is preferred, and it is assumed that some time can be spent in Nuremberg and/or Prague.

Apply now
Ask a question

About SUSE

We are a global technology business where the diversity of our employees inspires innovation. We value the individual contribution and expertise of our people across roles and functions.  With strong and accessible leaders, we expect our people to collaborate and deliver market-leading solutions to our customers.

  • We enable you to succeed. SUSE is an Open Source pioneer and market leader. You will learn from industry experts and bring the latest technology to market; regardless of your role.
  • Manage your future: We set the expectations and you find the solutions! You are encouraged to discover our people, business, communities and customers to deliver exceptional results.
  • We empower you to be bold. In a culture founded on collaboration and knowledge-sharing, you will be responsible for exceeding your own goals, and work across boundaries and hierarchies to deliver success for our customers.

Benefits

  • Collaborative Working enviroment
  • Home, virtual office
  • Good secondary benefits
  • Truly international enviroment and working culture

items.title: Airtame (https://airtame.com) | Copenhagen, Denmark | Full-time, Onsite/Remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=16, frontend=0}
items.content:
Airtame (https://airtame.com) | Copenhagen, Denmark | Full-time, Onsite/Remote

Airtame is a fast-growing startup. Our wireless streaming solution helps people work better. We are based in windy Copenhagen, but have an office in New York that takes care of our U.S. customers. We're currently hiring:

* Lead DevOps Engineer - Copenhagen, Denmark (https://airtame.com/jobs?gh_jid=4036513002)

* Head of Engineering - Copenhagen, Denmark (https://airtame.com/jobs?gh_jid=4031232002)

* Senior Embedded Linux Engineer - Copenhagen, Denmark or Europe (https://airtame.com/jobs?gh_jid=4010452002)

* Digital Designer - Copenhagen, Denmark (https://airtame.com/jobs?gh_jid=4010466002)

* Web Developer - Copenhagen, Denmark (https://airtame.com/jobs?gh_jid=4017568002)

Our talented engineers are given significant ownership and responsibility over projects. We value rapid iteration, continuous integration and testing, and we are serious about producing high-quality, maintainable software. Frequent code reviews, linting, and pairing are all integral components of our engineering culture. We encourage experimenting with new technologies and constantly challenge ourselves to improve our code, processes, and systems.

You can read a bit about our values on our Company Culture Favro Board: https://favro.com/widget/2114a98cde73c1145a93bd8e/28429a2449....

We sponsor work visas for non-EU applicants.

items.title: Senior Backend Engineer - IoT Cloud
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Backend Engineer - IoT Cloud at Centaur Analytics

Volos, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
$25K–$40K
0.2%–2.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

Centaur Technologies (www.centaurtek.com) develops products for the Industrial IoT, focusing on stored product protection and other verticals. The company runs on a fast track, driven by seasoned entrepreneurs who have done it before. The company's founder and CEO - Sotiris Bantas - was CTO and cofounder of Helic, an EDA software company started in Athens which evolved into an international technology player with customers and investors in Silicon Valley.

We are looking for an experienced and motivated full-stack developer to undertake the buildout and maintenance of our IoT apps, which employ embedded servers, cloud servers, mobile terminals and wearable devices. The position entails customer-facing responsibilities with our growing customer base. Perks include participation in international conferences and training opportunities.

You should have:

- A BS/MS degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering or a related subject.

- Solid experience in the administration of backend servers for high performance mobile or web app stacks.

- Experience in developing software for mobile apps or mobile-first web apps.

- Familiarity with mobile app SDKs (iOS or Android) and notification systems.

- Experience in working with remote data via third-party APIs and JSON.

You should be entrepreneurial and willing to take risks, but also customer-driven and devoted to a high quality and reliability product. You should have great presentation and communication skills and the leadership qualities needed for recruiting your own team and infusing your DNA into the company.

Are you this person? If so, come join the action!

Please copy the link on your browser to view our Privacy Policy: http://centaur.ag/website-policy/
